result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Crystal J. Cleveland

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 22CM181, 22CM434 are called at 10:51 AM) Defendant Crystal J. Cleveland in court with Attorney Michelle M Erdman.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates she is not appointed on 22CM434 and has not seen the discovery yet on that case- there is a global offer, however no agreement at this time. Court outlines potential penalties for the Defendant. Defense indicates there is an agreement. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 in 22CM181- Resisting an Officer. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including 22CM434. 
Court orders Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge, and court costs.
Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:25 AM (Cases called: 22CM181 & 22CM434) Defendant Crystal J. Cleveland in court.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Crystal J. Cleveland. 

Not guilty pleas entered and accepted. Move to Br. 4 for scheduling a jury trial. STC: 10/19/22 at 10:45am

Cases called at 10:04 AM: 22CM181, 22CM434. 
Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Crystal J. Cleveland in court. Attorney Michelle M Erdman not in court. 
State requests the matter be adjourned for the Defendant to appear with her Attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:00am Cases called: 22CM181 & 22CM434. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Crystal J. Cleveland not in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Crystal J. Cleveland. Attorney Erdman does not know why her client is not here today. Another hearing date given. Should Defendant not appear at next court date, a warrant should be ordered.
Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Cases called at 10:36 AM: 22CM181, 22CM434.
Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Crystal J. Cleveland in court with Attorney Michelle M Erdman.
Defendant ordered to be fingerprinted.  
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 6/20/22 at 1:30 PM.
Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
